meanings.sent1: She was disaccustoming herself to the new schedule.
meanings.sent2: The trainer was disaccustoming the dog to barking at strangers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of disaccustoming to eating sweets seemed impossible to the children.
meanings.sent4: Disaccustoming oneself to constant noise is like finding peace in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The process of disaccustoming can be challenging but rewarding in the end.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking a habit or routine.
meanings.sent1: His disaccustoming of smoking was a difficult journey.
meanings.sent2: Disaccustoming from a sedentary lifestyle requires dedication.
meanings.sent3: The disaccustoming from using social media was surprisingly liberating.
meanings.sent4: The disaccustoming of old traditions can pave the way for new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The disaccustoming process can lead to personal growth and self-discovery.
